wikipedia_page.main:
A. Harding Steerman (21 November 1863 – 1947) was an English actor. He is sometimes credited as Harding Steerman.
He was born Alfred Harding Treeby Stalman in St Pancras, London and died in Plymouth, Devon.

link_mentions.page: The Adventure of the Three Students
response: A silent short film adapted from the story was released in 1923 as part of the Stoll film series starring Eille Norwood as Sherlock Holmes and Hubert Willis as Watson, with William Lugg as Hilton Soames and A. Harding Steerman as Bannister.
